title: What are the benefits of having a healthy population? - Quora

response.answer_text: Who ‘merges’ questions? The original question I saw was “What are the benefits of high population?”* This is a VERY different question than “What are the benefits of having a healthy population?” and merging these two ideas here is NOT appropriate and doing so an error. Regarding the original question, the benefits of having a high (presumably Human) population depends upon the perspective assumed. If we look at the question from the Human perspective, there are no benefits at all because a high population unburdened by predation just gets higher faster and faster until it crashes. In biology, the crash is as certain as Gravity. If we look at the question from the Earth’s perspective there is great benefit as a past experiment fails and it gets on with its experiments in producing a mechanism of intersteller reproduction. This is what all life seeks, to spread itself and we see that natural selection has found many mechanisms to facilitate this. In some form or another, Earth will spread but we, clearly, will not be the seed carriers. And, a “healthy” Human population, meaning ALL Humans, can never be a “high” Human population on this so finite Earth. *You were redirected because the question What are the benefits of high population? was merged with this question

More discoveries arising out of diversity, and genetic analogs to that. But there are none long-term if high means over. R-strategists are still bound by carrying capacity. Support for Ponzi-type economic schemes is not a benefit to anyone.
